moves.1. e4: White begins with the very solid 1. e4.
moves.1... e6: Black responds with the rather meek 1 ...e6?
moves.2. d4: Punishing black for his mistake and grabbing control of the center.
moves.3. Nc3: White continues development among normal lines. A transition into a Danish Gambit main line is certainly possible here.
moves.3... d5 4. Nf3: White plays the brilliant move 4. Nf3!, attacking Black's queen.
moves.4... Qh5 5. Be2 dxe4 6. Nxe4 Nf6 7. Nfg5: Terrible move! Black allows his queen to be trapped.
moves.8. g3: 8. g3!!! White takes full advantage of the overextended queen!
moves.8... Nxe4 9. gxh4 Nxg5 10. hxg5: White is ahead material, and now begins trading down pieces to arrive at a highly favorable endgame.
Not realizing that his rook is hanging, black foolishly tries to harass White's queen. However, White was attentive this game, and grabs the rook.
moves.21. Qxb8: At this point, a hardy "gg noob" was declared by White.
moves.21... Kf7: Black makes a desperate thrust with his monarch.
